problem_description:
For an integer N, we will choose a permutation \{P_1, P_2, ..., P_N\} of \{1, 2, ..., N\}.
Then, for each i=1,2,...,N, let M_i be the remainder when i is divided by P_i.
Find the maximum possible value of M_1 + M_2 + \cdots + M_N.

For an integer N, we will choose a permutation \{P_1, P_2, ..., P_N\} of \{1, 2, ..., N\}.
Then, for each i=1,2,...,N, let M_i be the remainder when i is divided by P_i.
Find the maximum possible value of M_1 + M_2 + \cdots + M_N.
